projects.name: Software Engineer
projects.description:
Ongoing work on new products and site features. Mostly C++ and Python but some frontend too. Highlights include Crazy Blind Date, Locals, Facebook integration, and Bitcoin payments. Work on OkCupid’s web server, core C++ library, and distrubuted matching system. Also includes assorted security and side projects (fixing data leaks, internal security, dev tooling).

OkCupid enginneering is small (~10 people) for a big site; I have a lot of independence.

projects.name: Envoy
projects.description: A proprietary asset tracking system to manage 750+ client Macs. Envoy sends in reports, lets users submit support requests, integrates with remote access software, keeps itself up-to-date, and can be remotely reconfigured or uninstalled.

projects.name: Technician tools
projects.description: Web system used by technicians for asset tracking, case managment, and scheduling. Talks to Envoy, PBX, remote access system, CalDAV, and vendor APIs.

projects.name: Technical service and support
projects.description: Onsite and remote client Mac and network support.

projects.name: Side projects
projects.description:
- Hacked up a Node.js news extraction engine powered by [Readability](http://lab.arc90.com/experiments/readability/) for Hans Haacke’s “News” (New Museum: [“The Last Newspaper”](http://archive.newmuseum.org/index.php/Detail/Occurrence/Show/occurrence_id/1080), SFMOMA: [permanent collection](http://www.sfmoma.org/explore/collection/artwork/126255).)

- Worked with the NYPD to recover data contributing to a criminal investigation.

- Reconstructed code from an x86 binary.

projects.name: Team(.cpp)
projects.description: My main side project right now is [Team](https://github.com/Sidnicious/team), a library that adds coroutines and async semantics to C++. Includes Go-style channels, Python-style generators, and Tame (OkCupid) style await blocks. I’m always down to talk about it.

projects.name: Answering questions
projects.description: Enjoy helping other programmers, in the top 10% [on Stack Overflow](http://stackoverflow.com/users/84745/sidnicious) for HTML- and JavaScript-related answers.

projects.name: Hacker School
projects.description: Batch[2] of [Hacker School](http://www.hackerschool.com/), a three-month, full time retreat for programmers. Worked on live video processing in JavaScript, coroutines, a Lisp interpreter, and more fun stuff.

projects.name: Old stuff
projects.description:
- Credited for security issues in Mac OS and iOS ([CVE-2010-0537](http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-0537), [CVE-2010-1754](http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-1754)).

- Lead programmer on a team of three at NYC’s first (and so far, only) Hack Club run by Reddit-cofounder Alexis Ohanian. We built an autonomous Lego robot in twelve hours and [won fame and fortune](http://breadpig.com/blogs/news/5863229-hack-club-1-total-success).

- Submitted a patch to Git to let it format commit messages when you view them, so that you don't rely on everyone else wrapping to 80 characters. Patch is ahead of its time, was rejected.

- Lead programmer at DISTRO.fm, a (likely-)failed nonprofit music distribution platform.

- Lead programmer on my high school's FIRST robotics team. Built competition robots which won regional championships and earned awards at regional and international levels.
